definition: paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

sentences.english: This time-line must be brought to the workshop.
sentences.chinese: 請一定把這張紙帶到工作坊來。

sentences.english: She slowly crossed through, leaving both ends of the paper fluttering behind her.
sentences.chinese: 她慢慢地衝過終點，紙帶在她的身後飄舞。

sentences.english: A perforation, as in a punched card or paper tape.
sentences.chinese: 在穿孔卡片或紙帶上穿孔的一種動作。

sentences.english: You fed instructions in on paper tape, and loaded the data on punch cards.
sentences.chinese: 輸入紙帶上的指令，並裝載穿孔卡片上的數據。

sentences.english: Fill a jewelry box with them. Wrap 'em up and present them to your partner.
sentences.chinese: 把紙帶裝在一個首飾盒中，幷包起來送給你的戀人。

sentences.english: I didn't actually bring it this year.
sentences.chinese: 我今年沒把那張紙帶過來。

sentences.english: Each piece of Dyed Poplin bears face plait stamping and is wrapped in cellophane with a paper hand at each end.
sentences.chinese: 染色府綢每匹蓋有梢印外包玻璃紙，兩端各系有紙帶。

definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
sb who goes whichever way the wind blows/sb with no mind of their own/easily swayed person/opportunist
